# Government Tender Announcement

## Solicitation Title
Police Uniforms and Bicycle Clothing for the Royal Canadian Mounted Police

## Solicitation Number
202401342

## Closing Date
2023-10-02 14:00:00 (Ottawa Time)

## Industry Classification
Police uniforms and bicycle clothing (UNSPSC 53102703)

## Procurement Category
Goods and Services (Category GD)

## Description
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) is seeking to purchase police uniforms and bicycle clothing as per the specifications outlined in this tender notice. The proposed procurement will be conducted in two phases: Phase 1 is an expression of interest by interested bidders, and Phase 2 is a Request for Proposal (RFP) with specific details of the requirement.

## Requirements
The RCMP requires a firm quantity of 620 windsuits, 125 bicycle trousers, and additional quantities of regular and special sizes. The procurement is limited to Canadian goods, as per Article 503.4(b) of the Canadian Free Trade Agreement.

## Evaluation Criteria
Bidders will be evaluated based on the lowest evaluated price (1 contract only).

## Contact Information
For any inquiries or submissions, please contact Marie-Eve Brunet at marie-eve.brunet@rcmp-grc.gc.ca or (514) 208-1137.

## Attachments
Please see the attached SUBMISSION OF INTEREST form and Non-Disclosure and Confidentiality of Information Agreement (NDCIA).

## Important Notes
* The bidder must complete and sign the SUBMISSION OF INTEREST form and NDCIA and send it via email to the Contracting Authority.
* Bidders must only submit their interest through this method; submissions received by any other means will not be considered.
* Canada will not be responsible for any failure attributable to the transmission or receipt of the submissions.

## Federal Indigenous Business Directory
Bidders are encouraged to register with the Federal Indigenous Business Directory to increase their visibility and competitiveness in government procurement opportunities.

## Integrity Regime
The RCMP has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada. As a result, the integrity provisions are being applied in RCMP contracting activities, as outlined in the solicitation package.

## Contracting Authority
Marie-Eve Brunet, Royal Canadian Mounted Police, Procurement, Materiel and Assets Management Branch, 73 Leikin Drive, Mailstop #1, Ottawa, Ontario, K1A 0R2
